Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location, Pretty Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rash K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The place is good value for money given its location which is 5 minutes from the Colosseum, about 1 minute from a Metro Stop and easy walking to the major attractions. The room was clean and comfortable and beds were made up each morning. The Breakfast was very basic, a packaged croissant, tea, coffee, juice. As with some of the other comments, this isn't a 4 star hotel so you do need to set your expectations. The main draw back for my family (we have two children) was the noise level. We were in room number 1 which faced the main road and even with the glazed windows shut the traffic noise was very loud through the night and into the early hours. It appeared that most of the rooms faced this same direction with the exception of one or two. Needless to say we didn't get much sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Claire F
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was minimalist but totally fine (tea/coffee/fruit juice + toast/cereal/croissant). Wi-fi was good in the rooms except the ones furthest down the hall (I was moved from room 5 to room 3 because of this, and my friend in room 4 was having problems). Staff were friendly and helpful, though you should be prepared to try out your Italian with the housekeepers (one guy, Luca, speaks English very well). Overall a nice, small, quiet hotel in a good location. (I didn't have any of the problems with the showers that other reviewers mentioned - they were on the small side but totally manageable for an average sized person)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: lindaMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 stayed here for 3 nights before a cruise. We wanted 2 rooms but they only had a quadruple room available, so we took it. I informed them that we are 2 couples as I did not want to end up in a twin bed, and that is exactly what happened ! The quadruple room was not big enough to accomodate 2 queen sized beds, it had 1 king size, with one twin bed at the side and another twin near the foot. But for the price of 140 E for 4 people, we did not bother to complain. It was good we had asked for a taxi service from the airport for 50 E, as this place is hard to find ! However for location, it can't be beat : walking distance to the train station, the Coloseum and other attractions, eateries, etc. On check out day, we just walked with our luggage to the Termini station where we took the train to Venice. Other pluses are the free computer/ internet use, and the airconditioning . Over all, I'd say it's good value for the money because of its location. Good enough for those looking for a basic, affordable, well- located place to sleep, but not for honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Central, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: Hobsbawm
Reviews.Content: The quality of a place you stay depends a lot on your expectations. This is not a 5* hotel, but good value considering price, location and the standard of the rooms. Breakfast is self-service and to be taken to your room; as in all Italian hotels, it is not considered the main meal of the day (croissant, juice, coffee). Despite its location above one of Rome's busiest roads, the rooms are quiet. Some parts in the bathroom could be renewed, but all appliances worked and were clean. I certainly recommend this place to anyone who looks for a B&B in the 2-3* category.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable - added bonus wireless internet connection!”
Reviews.Author: AmyFromSacramento
Reviews.Content: The Tourist House was perfect for my family (myself, husband and our 4 year old)! It was in a great location - just a block or so away from the Colosseum and right behind the building was a mecca of delicious restaurants and eateries. The host & co-owner, Pompeo was extremely nice and helpful. Although the accomodations weren't luxurious, for the price we were pleasantly surprised - the room and private bathroom was clean and comfortable (a little small but we expected that in Rome) and even had a flat screen tv and wireless internet connection. Only being in Rome 3 days, we were not planning to stay in our room much and spent most of our time sightseeing so we did not need hotel type amenities. I read another review about the guest not realizing Tourist House did not have a 24 hour reception but Pompeo made me aware before we arrived what the check in times were and requested the estimated timeframe we would be arriving so he could welcome us. When it was time for us to leave for the airport Pompeo arranged for a car service to pick us up, which they did - right on time. We would stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!!”
Reviews.Author: momentumCanada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a good, clean, budget hotel close to everything Rome has to offer, and this was exactly what we were looking for! It was above average as the value of the location [5-10 min walk to the Coliseum and new entrance to Forum, 10-15 min walk to Trajan's Column and Capitoline hill, 15-20 min walk to the downtown core: Pantheon, etc.] and the pleasant service we had from the staff and Luca and Pompeo, the two brothers who run the Tourist House. This is not a frills B&B however the service was always with a smile and the place was clean. We had a cute little room that looked out to Cavour. They were most accommodating for our schedule and when we did not arrive on time [delayed flight], they made other arrangements to get us the keys, as they are not staffed 24hours. This is no problem but do not expect room service… The free internet was a huge asset and we would grab a snack in the morning from the lobby room. It’s not hard to find if you have the address with you; although there is no large sign, you simply have to count the building numbers [its between an internet cafe and a fantastic cafe just feet away from the Cavour Station {which is the best way to get there if you do not mind taking the Metro, as it is simply one stop from Termini on the B LINE heading the LAURENTINA direction}] All in all we would highly recommend this House to anyone who needs to have value when visiting the sights of Rome, but wont sacrifice polite service and cleanliness!

Reviews.Title: “Self Serve B & B”
Reviews.Author: tuscandreamer_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I finished up our honeymoon in Rome. Choose the Tourist House because of the location to the ancient center. The location is PERFECT- we walked to Colesseum,Trevi Fountain, Spanish Stairs, Pantheon... all the way to the Vatican! So we really only went back to the B & B, to shower and sleep. It is a bit difficult to find- no signs, a lift is availalbe to get to the fifth floor. We were greeted and given 2 keys one for the front of the building and one for our room. It felt like a hostel or college dorm. Our room was clean, our bathroom small with some water problems and the breakfast was left on a little table for you to fetch yourself. When we arrived we were both unsure if it was safe- we have travelled and never experienced anything as no frills. It did serve it purpose for sleeping accomodations, but not worth the money we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “good budget B&B”
Reviews.Author: Yozza4
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a more up to date review of this B&B as the others are all pretty bad. We stayed here for one night as our original B&B (B&B suburbe roma) had double booked us. We were dropped off in a taxi outside the buidling so we found it ok, but i can see that it might be hard to find on your own. There was limited signage to the B&B once in the apartment lobby but we worked out it was on the 5th floor quick enough and despite not speaking any italian. The lift was small but worked fine. We found the host to be very friendly, he showed us around the room and pointed out the facilities (fridge with free drinks in lobby area, free internet access, fridge in your room). The room was clean and comfortable, although the bathroom was very small. I fitted in the shower ok (and i am quite a big girl) and the air-con worked perfectly although it did drain into the shower which seemed a bit unhygenic. The double glazing was great it really sound proofed our room. we didn't try breakfast but it looked ok if basic. we enjoyed our one night here and i have recommended it to my mom, so it must be ok! we thought it was a good budget B&B in an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Schom
Reviews.Content: I couldn't agree more with the first review, "Book here if you like cold showers." We reserved two rooms about a month prior to visiting Rome for vacation. Traveling in group of 8 (4 adults and 4 children). When we dialed the number, we got an english speaking person who was great to work with. He answered questions and arranged airport shuttle to pick us up at the airport. Upon our arrival to the Tourist House, there wasn't any sign on the building etc...just a small business card next to the 'bell buttons'... --> Good luck finding this place in the dark without guidence. Once we figured out the lift and got to the floor we were greeted by an individual (described in the first review) who did not speak English -- he attempted to be very helpful...but really couldn't verbally answer any of our questions... The rooms were very, very, very, very small and 'gross'... The ceilings had black stuff growing on them... The beds were extremely uncomfortable and the windows were not sound proof. The rooms did have A/C; however, they drained directly into the shower. My daughter walked from one room to another {almost across the hall}--the bottom of her feet were completely black... The bathrooms were very, very small and described to detail in the first review. The shower was so small you could not move around to wash yourself without hitting the shower doors (too small for my 9 year old more less an adult). Speaking of shower doors, they were cheap plastic that were cracked, soap scummed. Water was a mix of hot -- my wife's shower was more cold... One door had about 4-7 inches of scotch tape holding it to the rails; the other kept falling off.... The tank above the tolet leaked... The ceiling had black stuff growing on it too... Breakfast was described perfectly in the first review.... I have traveled in Europe for 3-years now -- definetely not the 'typical European breakfast'..... After experiencing a terrible night (we arrived around 12 am and was pretty much committed to staying the first night -- didn't want to be 'homeless' in Rome at midnight with 4 children), we decided to check out... Early the next morning, we found a very nice hotel right next to the Tourist House {Via Cavour 213-M } for almost the same prices (granted they gave us Space-A price). We approaced the non-speaking English man (who was barefoot) to check out. He called the English Speaking individual who insisted that his rooms were very nice and that since we reserved 3 nights we had to pay for 3 nights--was charged for only 2 nights (remember though, was paying for two different rooms; both rooms, same quality). Lesson for tourists, don't reserve multiple nights in advance if not completely sure you will be satisfied....

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location just a couple of blocks from the Forum and Colosseum. The rooms are nothing to write home about, but are excellent for groups looking for value. We travelled as a family (5 people) and stayed in one room with 5 beds, which ran us €160 per night--an incredible value. Meager breakfast in the morning, but that's just a good excuse to find a nice cafe to eat in. Unlike the other reviewer, we had plenty of hot water, enough for all five of us to shower without problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: The_Elephant
Reviews.Content: I totally disagree with the other review. The location of Tourist House (Via Cavour) was pretty much perfect. You could walk to just about everything, except the Vatican. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area. Plus the Colosseum and Roman Forum are 3 minutes away. The owner of the place was really helpful, we even got a discount because we payed in cash, but you can pay with your creditcard as well. The rooms are lovely, they look exactly like they do on the website. They're spacious with AC, although the bathroom is a bit small, and they clean the room every day. They also give you the key to the apartment buidling, the apartment itself and your room so you can come and go as you like. Also, there is a computer with internet that you are free to use as much as you want to! About the cold water.. Yes, the apartment building is being renovated but we never once had cold water. It's located on the fifth floor but don't worry, there is an elevator. The breakfast is a very typical european breakfast. This kind of breakfast is what you're gonna get in pretty much all regions of Europe. That's just how it is. We had such a pleasant stay at this place, I'd defintely stay here again without a doubt.
